snippet: More than a dozen governors invoked the Newtown, Conn.,  shooting as they opened their legislative sessions. But the debate has not always followed party lines.
abstract: More than dozen governors invoked Newtown school shooting in their State of the State addresses, and most have weighed in on shooting in other forums; debate over curbing gun violence is breaking down mostly along partisan lines in the nation’s statehouses, with several Democratic governors calling for stricter gun laws and most Republicans urging tighter security or revamped mental health policies; handful of exceptions show political and geographical complexities of the issue.
lead_paragraph: More than a dozen governors invoked the Newtown, Conn.,  shooting as they opened their legislative sessions. But the debate has not always followed party lines.

headline.seo: Varied State Responses to Issue of Gun Violence
headline.main: From State to State, Varied Responses to the Issue of Gun Violence
headline.print_headline: From State to State, Varied Responses to the Issue of Gun Violence
